document_data.Description: Being a type of flowering plant, belladonnas produced delicate purple bell-shaped flowers and black glossy berries. Its leaves and roots contained substance called [[atropine]]. If one were to cast ''[[speak with plants]]'' on some belladonnas, the plants would typically speak to the caster about [[lycanthropy]] and [[werewolves]].{{Cite organized play/LC/With Great Risks|15}}
document_data.Abilities: Belladonna were most famous for their ability to cure lycanthropy. However, they were also toxic - anyone eating them was likely to find themselves weakened physically. Consumption of their flowers was capable of inducing state of death-like sleep. Some claimed even the plant's touch was toxic and required protective gloves to harvest.
document_data.Habitats:
Belladonna was known to grow in parts of the [[High Forest]], as well as on the small [[Isle of Balduran]], in the [[Trackless Sea]]

Beyond the [[Prime Material plane]], belladonna could be found in both the [[Feywild]] and parts of the [[Domains of Dread]].

Uses.Magic:
Belladonna was used as a [[material component]] for a variety of charms, [[potion]]s, [[spell]]s,
* ''[[Conceal]]'' required an ointment, made in part with a pinch of powdered monkshood.<ref>
* ''[[Oswald's mending]]'' required belladonna leaves and roots.
* ''[[Protection from poison]]'' required a few belladonna leaves.
* It was also used in ''[[Silver Stake gas bombs|gas bombs]]'' invented by the lycanthrope-hunting organization known as the [[Silver Stake]].{{Cite web/The Search for the Circle of Vehlarr/Part Three}}
* Sublimate of belladonna plant when mixed with certain types of ashes was the main component in brewing the ''[[elixir of peerless focus]]''.

document_data.History: In the {{YearlinkName|1373}}, during a full moon [[Ryld Argith]] consumed a belladonna and its three leaves from a branch he received from [[Yarno|Yarno's]] grandfather after the former boy bit the [[drow]] on the wrist in his werewolf state that same evening. Belladonna prevented his first lycanthropic transformation.<ref><ref>
